title: Mistake to add teams to Six Nations - England coach Jones
description: The addition of more teams to the Six Nations would be a mistake, says England coach Eddie Jones.

title: Venice Carnival: The city celebrates months after flooding
description: Crowds wearing masks and costumes celebrate the weeks-long festival in style.

title: Six Nations 2020: all the best bits from the second week
description: Watch all the best bits from the second week of the 2020 Six Nations including sausages, underpants and a few missed kicks.

title: Can Sheff Utd ensure 'really good story' has European ending?
description: Flying high in the Premier League after a 12-year top-flight absence, Sheffield United may well qualify for a major European competition for the first time.

title: Storm Ciara: Floods and travel disruption as UK hit by severe gales
description: Gales disrupt air, rail and road travel nationwide as rivers burst their banks, flooding homes.

title: France top Six Nations table after beating Italy
description: France remain unbeaten in the Six Nations after a bonus-point win despite a lacklustre second half against Italy

title: Irish general election: First results coming in
description: Early tallies and the exit poll suggest a strong showing for Sinn Féin.

title: Naseem Shah, 16, becomes youngest bowler to take Test hat-trick
description: Pakistan's 16-year-old paceman Naseem Shah becomes the youngest bowler to take a Test hat-trick as the hosts closed on victory over Bangladesh in Rawalpindi.

title: Six Nations 2020: Romain Ntamack scores bonus point try for France against Italy
description: Romain Ntamack glides through to score a bonus point try for France against Italy in the Six Nations game at the Stade De France in Paris.

title: Sheff Utd close in on top four with fightback to beat Bournemouth
description: Sheffield United move up to fifth in the Premier League after fighting back to earn a dramatic win over Bournemouth in blustery conditions at Bramall Lane.

title: England survive late stumble to beat SA and draw ODI series
description: England secure a 1-1 series draw with South Africa by beating the hosts by two wickets in the third one-day international in Johannesburg.

title: Clyde 0-3 Celtic: Neil Lennon's side ease past Clyde in Scottish Cup
description: Celtic maintain their dreams of a fourth consecutive domestic treble as they stroll past League One Clyde and into the Scottish Cup last eight.

title: John Bercow: Ex-Speaker says he is victim of a conspiracy in peerage row
description: Ex-Speaker says it is "blindingly obvious" there is a campaign to keep him out of the House of Lords.

title: Coronavirus: Thousands on cruise ship allowed to disembark after tests
description: Some 3,600 people can finally disembark in Hong Kong after tests for coronavirus return negative.

title: Thailand shooting: Survivors recall ordeal of gun rampage
description: Shoppers put up makeshift barricades as a soldier aimed at victims' heads on a 16-hour rampage.

title: Babacar Diagne death: Girl, 15, arrested over killing of teenager
description: The girl is being questioned on conspiracy to murder Babacar Diagne in Coventry.

title: Storm Ciara helps plane beat transatlantic flight record
description: The BA Boeing 747-436 reached speeds of 825 mph in the jet stream accelerated by Storm Ciara.

title: ICC U19 Cricket World Cup final: India batsmen race to same end
description: Watch as India batsmen Atharva Ankolekar and Dhruv Jurel race each other to the same end for a photo finish call in their U19 Cricket World Cup final against Bangladesh.

title: Coronavirus: Fourth patient in UK diagnosed
description: The fourth case came as the UK's final rescue flight arrived in Oxfordshire.

title: Police have 'new information' in Barrymore pool death probe
description: An appeal and TV documentary about Stuart Lubbock's death in the entertainer's pool bring "new information".

title: Strictly Come Dancing's first 'relaxed' live show brings delight
description: Alfie finds the live shows stressful so was delighted when Strictly put on a relaxed performance.

title: Ukraine's teen bullying drama that shattered taboos and stirred a nation
description: Ukraine's Early Swallows is a TV hit, giving teenagers the courage to open up about their lives.

title: Honeyland: Life lessons from Europe's last wild beekeeper
description: The story of the woman at the centre of an Oscar-nominated film has struck a chord around the world.

title: Oscars 2020: 12 things to watch out for at Sunday's Academy Awards
description: The likely winners, memorable performers and other talking points ahead of Sunday's ceremony.

title: Has Airbnb grown a conscience?
description: Airbnb is the latest US company to pledge it will serve society. Has the corporate world grown a conscience?

title: The murder of Joy Morgan: 'My sister's death showed me life is precious'
description: It's been a year since Dionne's sister, Joy Morgan, was murdered by a man she met at her church.

title: Tracking IS from Syria to the Philippines
description: The BBC's Middle East correspondent Quentin Sommerville follows the spread of Islamic State group, from Syria to the Philippines.

title: 'I spent more than £500 on deposit-free renting'
description: Some renters are choosing the option without understanding the costs involved, housing groups warn.

title: How some women are still losing out on Oscars
description: A film critic explains why Oscar-winning roles for minority women are rarely strong leads.

title: Clare Grogan: 'I'm still waiting for the bubble to burst'
description: Gregory's Girl and Altered Images star Clare Grogan reveals the secret of surviving 40 years in the limelight.

title: The music icons captured by Scots amateur photographers
description: Chris Brickley spent months searching for amateur photos of gigs in Scotland between 1974 and 1990.

title: Solar Orbiter launch: what is it and what's it going to do?
description: Many scientists are calling it the UK's most important mission for a generation.
